column3: Would like feedback on the comments next to the imports.\n\nsometimes they can be helpful, but assuming one imports multiple things Iâ€™m not sure what styling to take or just omit.

I'd much rather we went the other way and removed all of the `// for` comments from include lines, for the reasons of maintainability explained here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21745#discussion_r618111630.

> I'd much rather we went the other way and removed all of the `// for` comments from include lines, for the reasons of maintainability explained here: [#21745 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21745#discussion_r618111630).

Agreed all around then. I've updated the code and removed the "for" comments next to include. Better to include those comments  in the PR itself.

Sho
> Looks better. All commits can be squashed.\n\nCommits got squashed. let me know if you need anything else
utACK 71c824ed6c\n\nChange looks good. Did you use a tool to find the missing includes?

> Change looks good. Did you use a tool to find the missing includes?

I am working on currently writing up a CMake build for the repo and did run into several issues especially with the secp256k1 libraries due to some different includes within that lib/module.

I generally just crank up all the warnings and flags for the compilers I use and other static analyzers, which also bring in "inc
Code review ACK 71c824ed6cf70b39ca09e8b3962f452f69523af0\nChecked that nothing outrageous was added, I did not verify that all the added includes are necessary individually.

> Would like feedback on the comments next to the imports.\n\nThat is not something we want to do. What is the value-add of putting `// for vector` next to `#include <vector>`? In the other cases, these comments would be fairly unmaintainable, frequently become out of date (if not managed in some automated way), would pollute diffs etc.
I agree. Changes have been implemented by removing comments from includes.
Done. Yep that was a question I was slightly mulling over. I'll take a look and see if i see the styling docs (if any).
